column4: my user account is no longer in the admin group!!! how can i fix this!
is xchat installed by default with ubuntu?
you may have to check system > preferences > menu layout
it's easy from there, just check it out
if it's not there then try Applications > Add/Remove
i'm not sure about that but i don't think preferences requires root privilege
you could start in recovery mode, which will give you root access... then usermod
no, you probably changed your default group instead of /adding/ yourself to another group...
reboot and keep pressing ESC after you see your BIOS summary... it only gives you 1-2 seconds and most of the time i never see the option
for future reference, i like "sudo gpasswd -a username groupname"
that won't change the user's /default/ group
these are the groups my default user was automatically added to: joe4444 adm dialout cdrom floppy audio dip video plugdev lpadmin scanner admin
i can't recall... check out man usermod
